member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1
member.summary: Class used to represent Criteria for retreiving items within the CMS. This class is used as the parameter to most GetList methods found in the Manager classe sin the Ektron.Cms.Framework APIs.
member.typeparam: The enum representing the propertys used for filtering the given data classes. For example, ContentProperty would be used for filtering in the ContentManager Api.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.AddFilter(`0,Ektron.Cms.Common.CriteriaFilterOperator,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new CriteriaFilter to the filter list.
member.param: operator to use on field and value for filter.

The value to filter on. The value should be the same data type as the corresponding property in the associated data class. For example, if Filtering on ContentProperty.Id, the value should be a long because ContentData.Id is a long. If using the CriteriaFilterOperator.In or NotIn operator, the Value you should be an IEnumerable list or List of long values.
member.returns: newly added filter.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.FindAllFieldFilters(`0)
member.summary: Used to find filters within the criteria that use the supplied Field value. Returns null if no filters are found.
member.param: The field value to find filters for.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.FindFieldFilter(`0)
member.summary: Used to find a filter within the criteria that use the supplied Field value. Returns the first one found or null if no filters are found.
member.param: The field value to find filters for.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.PopulateCommand(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{`0,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Populates the supplied command object with the Sql select statement and DBParameters based upon the current criteria object. The generated sql select statement generates the column list in the same order as supplied in the columnMap. A second statement is also created That returns a single value which is the total number of records available matching the criteria filter. Thsi would be used to populate the Criteria.PagingInfo.TotalRecords property.
member.param: Dictionary mapping T enum values to valid column names in db.
Name of table to create select statement for.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.GenerateSql(System.Data.Common.DbCommand,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{`0,System.String},System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Generates the where clause and order by clause for the current criteria object.
member.param: hashtable mapping T Field values to string column names.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.ToCacheKey
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the criteria that can be used as a cache key.

member.summary: Gets the default (first) filtergroup. Used for basic adding\removing filters.

member.summary: Set whether to use aggregation. This is is for internal use.

member.summary: Field to use for aggregation. This is is for internal use.

member.summary: The group by operation to apply to the results(Sum or None). This is is for internal use.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.GroupByField
member.summary: The group by field to apply to the results. This is is for internal use.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.Condition
member.summary: The Logical operator to apply to the filters. The default value is "AND".
member.remarks: The Criteira Condition controls the operator for the default filter group as well as the ANDing\Oring the filter groups together.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.PagingInfo
member.summary: The paging parameters to apply to the search. By default, PagingInfo.RecordsPerPage is set to 50. To retreive more records, modify this value.

member.summary: Set the property used to order the results.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.OrderByDirection
member.summary: Sets the order direction (Ascending or Descending).

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.Filters
member.summary: Lists of filters defined in this criteria object. To add new Filters, you can add them here or use the AddFilter method (reccomended).

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.FilterGroups
member.summary: Gets alist of filter groups. Filtergroups can be created to do filter grouping (i.e. parenthesis in the where clause). The groups use the criteria's Condition like other filters, but can use their own condition internally.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.Columns
member.summary: The columns of the criteria

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.RequiredFilterGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets a required filter group. This group will be appended to the final filter using an AND operator regardless of the criteria's defined Condition. This would be used to enforce language restriction, etc.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.Criteria`1.RequiredFilterSql
member.summary: Gets or sets a required filter. This sql will be added to the end of the where filter using an AND operator.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.CouponData.IsCombinable
member.summary: Determins whether or not this coupon can be combined with other coupons. If true, this coupon can be combined with other "Combinable" coupons.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.CouponData.IsApplicabletoSubscriptions
member.summary: Determines whether this coupon is applicable to subscription or not

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.CouponData.AppliesToQuantity
member.summary: For an DiscountType.Amount coupon, defines the applicable quantity for a single line in a basket. Default is 1. Example, if you have a $5 Amount coupon, and a quantity 5 of a $10 item (total cost $50), by default the coupon applies to the first item only: $50 - $5 = $45. Change the AppliesToQuantity value to 2, the coupon applies to 2 of the item quantity: $50 - $10 = $40. Change the AppliesToQuantity value to 3, the coupon applies to 3 of the item quantity: $50 - $15 = $35. And so on...

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.CouponData.UseCount
member.summary: Returns the count representing the number of orders that this coupon has been applied to.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData
member.summary: The PaymentGatewayData data class gets or sets information about a specified payment gateway. A payment gateway is the company that handles the payments from your site. CMS400.NET comes ready to use with several payment gateways installed, including Authorize.net and PayFlow. Each payment gateway provider accepts configuration parameters.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.Validate
member.summary: Validates the PaymentGatewayData object is valid for saving.
member.returns: Returns a ValidationResult object with any validation errors.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the CMS400.NET ID for the payment gateway data object. You cannot set the ID of a newly created data object. The ID of an object is set internally by CMS400.NET during the creation (Add) process. You can set the ID of the object for updating purposes.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name associated with the payment gateway. For example, if you were adding information for a payment gateway company called EkPay, enter "EkPay" for this property. When creating a payment gateway, a name value is required.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the user ID associated with a payment gateway. This is not a CMS400.NET user ID. This information is supplied by the payment gateway.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password associated with a payment gateway. This is not a CMS400.NET password. This information is supplied by the payment gateway.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this payment gateway is the default in CMS400.NET. * True = default payment gateway * False = not the default payment gateway

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.IsCustom
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this payment gateway is a custom payment gateway or one that comes pre-installed with Ektron CMS400.NET. Set this property to true when creating a custom payment gateway. * True = is a custom payment gateway * False = is not a custom payment gateway

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.CustomFieldOne
member.summary: Gets or sets the first custom field a payment gateway might require. Each type of payment gateway provider accepts configuration parameters. For example, Authorize.NET requires a username and password while PayFlow requires a username, password, vendor, and partner. So, if you were creating an object for PayFlow, you would enter the required vendor information in this property. If your payment gateway does not require additional information, leave blank.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.CustomFieldTwo
member.summary: Gets or sets the second custom field a payment gateway might require. Each type of payment gateway provider accepts configuration parameters. For example, Authorize.NET requires a username and password while PayFlow requires a username, password, vendor, and partner. So, if you were creating an object for PayFlow, you would enter the required partner information in this property. If your payment gateway does not require additional information, leave blank.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.AllowsCreditCardPayments
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the payment gateway accepts credit cards. * True = the payment gateway accepts credit cards * False = the payment gateway does not accept credit cards

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Commerce.PaymentGatewayData.AllowsCheckPayments
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the payment gateway accepts check payments. * True = the payment gateway accepts check payments * False = the payment gateway does not accept check payments

member.summary: Gets or sets the operator to use for the filter.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.CriteriaFilter`1.Value
member.summary: The value to filter on. The value should be the same data type as the corresponding property in the associated data class. For example, if Filtering on ContentProperty.Id, the value should be a long because ContentData.Id is a long. If using the CriteriaFilterOperator.In operator, the Value you should be an IEnumerable list of values.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.Common.CriteriaFilterGroup`1
member.summary: Data class representing a group of Criteria Filters. The groups translates into a group of filter statements wrapped in parenthesis.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.CriteriaFilterGroup`1.AddFilter(`0,Ektron.Cms.Common.CriteriaFilterOperator,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new CriteriaFilter to the filter list.
member.param: operator to use on field and value for filter.

The value to filter on. The value should be the same data type as the corresponding property in the associated data class. For example, if Filtering on ContentProperty.Id, the value should be a long because ContentData.Id is a long. If using the CriteriaFilterOperator.In or NotIn operator, the Value you should be an IEnumerable list or List of long values.
member.returns: newly added filter.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData
member.summary: Class represents a recurrence pattern. Patterns are created using Factory Methods.
member.remarks: To avoid possible invalid data patterns, all fields are readonly and patterns must be created using factory.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.GetDayOfWeekList
member.summary: Converts the EventRecurrence.RecurrenceDayOfWeek flag values to a list of DayOfWeek Enum Values.
member.returns: List of DayOfWeek values for the current Recurrence

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateNonRecurrence
member.summary: Creates an empty EventRecurrence with a recurrenceType of None.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateDailyRecurrence(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a recurrence for a daily event.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = daily, 2 = every other day, 3 = every third day, etc.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateDailyRecurrence(Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceDaysOfWeek)
member.summary: Create a recurrence for a daily event.
member.param: identifies which days does this event occur. ie. mon, mon\wed\fri, etc.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateWeeklyRecurrence(System.Int32,Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceDaysOfWeek)
member.summary: Create a recurrence for a weekly event.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = weekly, 2 = every other week, 3 = every third week, etc.
identifies which days does this event occur. ie. mon, mon\wed\fri, etc.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateMonthlyByDayRecurrence(System.Int32,Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceDayOfMonth,Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceDaysOfWeek)
member.summary: Create a monthly recurrence that occurs based upon the relative week. For example, every month on the first Tuesday.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = monthly, 2 = every other month, 3 = every third month, etc.
Identifies which week of the month the event occurs.
identifies the day this event occurs on. i.e. The third Tuesday.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateMonthlyByDayRecurrence(System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Create a monthly recurrence that occurs based upon the relative week. For example, every month on the first Tuesday.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = monthly, 2 = every other month, 3 = every third month, etc.
A date time that represents the day of week occurance to use.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateMonthlyByDateRecurrence(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a monthly recurrence that occurs based upon a specific date of the month. For example, every month on the 15th.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = monthly, 2 = every other month, 3 = every third month, etc.
identifies which day of the month the event occur. ie. 1st, 3rd, 15th, etc. For last day of month, use -1.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateYearlyRecurrence(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a recurrence for a yearly event for a given monthly date. For example, every year on April 15th.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = yearly, 2 = every other year, 3 = every third year, etc.
The integer representing the month of the year this event occurs.
The specific day of the month this event occurs. For example, the 15th.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceData.CreateYearlyRecurrence(System.Int32,System.Int32,Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceDayOfMonth,Ektron.Cms.Common.RecurrenceDaysOfWeek)
member.summary: Create a recurrence for a yearly event for a given monthly day. For example, every year on the first tuesday of april.
member.param: Identifies how often this event occurs. for example, 1 = yearly, 2 = every other year, 3 = every third year, etc.
The integer representing the month of the year this event occurs.
The specific day of the month this event occurs. For example, the last weekday.
The day of the week this event occurs. For example, the second tuesday.

member.summary: This class contains properties related to database sync.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.CoreService.DatabaseSyncStatistics.LocalStartingRowVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the local starting row version. This is a number corresponding to the database timestamp value starting from (and including) which rows are synced from the local database.
member.remarks: This value will only be available after (if) database sync completes.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.CoreService.DatabaseSyncStatistics.LocalEndingRowVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the local ending row version.This is a number corresponding to the database timestamp value ending at (and including) which rows are synced from the local database.
member.remarks: This value is not populated currently, and if present will only be available after (if) database sync completes.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.CoreService.DatabaseSyncStatistics.RemoteStartingRowVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote starting row version. This is a number corresponding to the database timestamp value starting from (and including) which rows are synced from the remote database.
member.remarks: This value will only be available after (if) database sync completes.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.CoreService.DatabaseSyncStatistics.RemoteEndingRowVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the remote ending row version. This is a number corresponding to the database timestamp value ending at (and including) which rows are synced from the remote database.
member.remarks: This value is not populated currently, and if present will only be available after (if) database sync completes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the approval method of a content item for the ContentData object. member.remarks: If the content is inheriting the approval method from the folder, the IsInherited property must be false to change this property.

members.member:
Gets or set whether or not to force all approvers to approve the content that is added to the folder. This is for the FolderData object.
0 = Do Not Force All Approvers - content checked-out during the approval process will continue through the approval chain.
1 = Force All Approvers - content checked-out during the approval process forces the approval chain to reset to the beginning.
Returns 0 (zero) if you are not forcing all approvers.
Returns 1 (one) if you are forcing all approvers.
[Obsolete("This property is no longer supported. Use ApprovalType")]

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderData.ApprovalType
member.summary:
Gets or set whether or not to force all approvers to approve the content that is added to the folder. This is for the FolderData object.
DoNotApprove = Do Not Force All Approvers - content checked-out during the approval process will continue through the approval chain.
Approve = Force All Approvers - content checked-out during the approval process forces the approval chain to reset to the beginning.
member.returns:
Returns EkEnumeration.FolderApprovalType.DoNotApprove if you are not forcing all approvers.
Returns EkEnumeration.FolderApprovalType.Approve if you are forcing all approvers.

members.member:
Gets or sets the type of folder in the Workarea. The FolderType property can be used to verify if a given folder accepts the type of content being submitted. This is for the FolderData object.
Available Types:
* 0 = Content - a content folder that contains assets, documents and HTML content. * 2 = Domain - designates the folder as a domain folder when using the Multi-site feature. * 5 = Root - Specifies a folder as root folder. This option is not available. * 6 = Community - Membership users can add and edit content contained in these folders.
An integer value that equals a type of folder. Folder types are listed above.
can't mark obsolete workarea folder tree breaks. [Obsolete("This property is no longer supported. Use Type")]

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderData.Type
member.summary:
Valid FolderTypes:
* Content = Content - a content folder that contains assets, documents and HTML content. * Domain = Domain - designates the folder as a domain folder when using the Multi-site feature. * Root = Root - Specifies a folder as root folder. This option is not available. * Community = Community - Membership users can add and edit content contained in these folders.
member.returns: Returns folderType from FolderType Enumeration.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderData.IsContentSearchableInherited

Gets or sets whether IsContentSearchable is inherited from the parent folder. This is for the FolderData object.
True = IsContentSearchable is inherited from the parent folder.
False = IsContentSearchable is not inherited from the parent folder.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderData.IscontentSearchable
member.summary:

True = force ContentSearchable is required when creating or editing content.
False = force ContentSearchable is not required when creating or editing content.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormData
member.summary:
Describes a form design.
Declaration Example:
Dim formItem As Ektron.Cms.FormData
Dim formApi As New Ektron.Cms.Content.Form Dim formItem As Ektron.Cms.FormData formItem = formApi.GetForm(CInt(2))

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of the form. The description must be 255 characters or less.
member.remarks: The string should be plain text. HTML tags should not be used.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.LimitSubmissions
member.summary: Gets or sets if the form is allowed a limited number of submissions.
member.remarks: If true, NumberOfSubmissions must be set.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.StoreDataTo
member.summary: Specifies how the data should be processed. Valid values include: * "db" submitted data should be stored in the database. * "email" submitted data should be included in an email sent to the configured address(es). * "both" submitted data should stored in the database AND sent in an email.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.Autofill
member.summary: Specifies whether the form data should be automatically filled if the user is known and has previously entered data for this form.
member.returns: True if form data should be automatically filled. False if the form should always be blank.
member.remarks: Requires that data be stored in the database.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.MailTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the email address(es) to send an email to when form data is submitted. Multiple email addresses should be separated by semicolons (";").
member.remarks: Applies only when StoreDataTo is "email" or "both".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.MailFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the email address assigned as the sender when email is sent upon submittal of form data.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.MailSubject
member.summary: Gets or sets the subject of the email sent when form data is submitted. Maximum length is 128 characters.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.MailPreamble
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that precedes the submitted data in the body of the email sent when form data is submitted. Maximum length is 128 characters.
member.remarks: The string should be plain text. HTML tags should not be used.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.MailCc
member.summary: Gets or sets the email address(es) to copy an email to when form data is submitted. Multiple email addresses should be separated by semicolons (";").

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.SendXmlPacket
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the submitted form data should be emailed as well-formed XML data. * True - formats the data by making each field name a tag around each value. * False - sends the data without consideration whether it is well-formed XML.
member.remarks:
The XML structure of the form data submitted is:
<cmsMail> <FormTitle>This is the Title</FormTitle> <FormDescription>This is the description.</FormDescription> <date>7/11/2005 5:24:58 PM</date> <MailTo></MailTo> <MailFrom></MailFrom> <MailCc></MailCc> <MailSubject></MailSubject> <MailPreamble></MailPreamble> <Data> <Field1>Value of Field 1</Field1> <Field2>Value of Field 2</Field2> <Field3>Value of Field 3</Field3> </Data> </cmsMail>
Note: The <date> is NOT ISO 8601. It's format is dependent on the web server.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.Validation
member.summary: Gets or sets the form's validation information as an array of FormValidationData.
member.returns: Ektron.Cms.FormValidationData()

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormData.PollRevision
member.summary: Gets or sets the revision number of the poll as a string.
member.returns: string
member.remarks: It is used in the browser cookie when users load the poll on a web page.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormSubmittedData.FormDataID
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric ID for the form data.
member.remarks: A value of -1 means the ID is undefined.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormSubmittedData.FormId
member.summary: Gets and sets the ID of the form associated with this submitted form data.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormSubmittedData.DateSubmitted
member.summary: Gets or sets the date the data in the DataItems() array was submitted.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormSubmittedData.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the user ID of the person who submitted the data. A value of 0 means anonymous.
member.remarks: UserId and UserInfo are not kept synchronized in this class.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormSubmittedData.UserInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the user information as an Ektron.Cms.UserData object.
member.remarks: UserId and UserInfo are not kept synchronized in this class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the array of the data associated with each field defined in the form.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.TaxonomyBaseData.TaxonomyType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of taxonomy that this taxonomyData represents. The standard taxonomy is 0, the others are specialized taxonomies specifically for managing things like community. This does not dictate the types of objects that can be applied to this taxonomy. Object configuration types is controlled by the TaxonomyConfigurations property. * Default = 0 * User's private taxonomy = 1 * Group's private taxonomy = 2 * Locale = 3
member.returns: The taxonomy's type.

member.summary: Gets the child taxonomies fo rthe current taxonomy. This property is only populated on retrieval and will be ignored when adding or updating a taxonomy node. To add children taxonomies, create a new taxonomy and set the parentId to the taxonomy you want it to save the taxonomy using TaxonomyManager.

member.summary: When True, include all items from the taxonomy's structure. When false, use only the taxonomy category's structure.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.TaxonomyRequest.IncludeDisabledNode
member.summary: When True, include all nodes irrespective of its node status. When false, returns only visible taxonomy category's structure.
member.returns: All all the taxonomy's structure.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.TaxonomyRequest.Depth
member.summary:
Gets or sets number of taxonomy levels to retrieve below each taxonomy/category. For example, if the taxonomy is Businesses > Restaurants > Pizza , and you set this property to 2, only Business and Restaurants are available in code behind.
To retrieve the all of the categories for a taxonomy recursively, enter -1.
The default value is 1.
Important! - For a live site, Ektron strongly recommends leaving this value at 1. Increasing this value can slow down your live Web server. However, for testing on a staging server, you can increase the depth.
member.returns: An integer representing the depth level.
member.remarks: This property should not be left empty. Enter a value at least a value of 1.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether preview content should be included in the taxonomy category.
member.returns: A boolean.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.UserRequestData.Type
member.summary: Differentiates request between Cms Users and Membership users. * 0 = to retrieve CMS400.NET users. * 1 = to retrieve Membership users. * -1 = to retrieve all users.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.UserRequestData.Group
member.summary: ID of User Group to retrieve users from. For example, set Group = 1 to retrieve only users that are members of group ID 1. Leave as -1 to retrieve users from all groups.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.UserRequestData.RequiredFlag
member.summary: Determines whether or not to retrieve deleted users. * 0 = to retrieve active users. * 1 = to retrieve deleted users.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.UserRequestData.OrderBy
member.summary: Sets the column by which the resultset is ordered. Possible values include: * user_id * user_name * first_name * last_name * language * email_address1 The default sort is last_name.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.UserRequestData.SearchText
member.summary: Possible search rules to apply to results using SQL syntax. For example, last_name = 'Jones'. Possible columns include: * user_id * user_name * first_name * last_name * language * email_address1

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.UserRequestData.OrderDirection
member.summary: Sets the order by which to sort the OrderBy column. Possible values are: * ASC * DESC ASC is the default value.
